data.text: Memory is not my strength per se. However, when it comes to emotion, feeling and personal meaning, it becomes much stronger and, of course, I know Clynx‚Äôs pitch pretty much by üíô When I need to significantly adapt my pitch, either in terms of length, context or framing, I try to train it at least a couple times and some of my favorite tricks are: ‚ö°Ô∏èrecording it on #voice while preparing the text - I basically record the first script sketch and listen to it on my walks. While walking, I am not actively training but I do not have distractions and I am particularly critical to improve the text, so it both helps memorizing and refining the message. ‚ö°Ô∏èrecording it on #video while preparing delivery of the pitch - to watch my expressions/movements as I talk! I will admit: not always I analyze it as much as I should, but it still forces me to be aware of the importance of the physical behavior (from posture, to gestures and use of space) during the speech. On #pitch‚Äôs mornings, my phone‚Äôs camera roll becomes even funnier, as I train 2 to 3 times - in between the moment I wake up until I get my makeup and am fully ready to be at the stage üòÖ When I leave the house, I suddenly do not want to review any of the text, audios or videos.
